title: MynaGoGama Protest continues demanding PM to resign
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lankans are still protesting in MynaGoGama in front of Temple Trees demanding the resignation of Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa.
Meanwhile, Sri Lanka Police on Wednesday (4) evening decided to remove the Police buses & trucks that were parked on the pavement opposite Temple Trees in Colombo.
Police informed the protestors at MynaGoGama that the court issued an order to vacate the premises.
The protestors are now located on the opposite side of the road.
Sri Lanka seeks fertilisers from India, deferral of payment of $2.5 billion
